fine if my plugin's jar file is included in the RT workbench:

Build exception: C:\eclipses\workspaces\runtime-
ourplugins\org.apache.log4j\ebuild.xml:10: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: 
setProject

The above exception is thrown for all my custom ant tasks, but actions defined 
in my plugin work fine without the jar file. Plugin.xml includes the following 
entry:

      <antTask
            library="ebuild.jar"
            name="getlibs"
            class="com.luosys.ebuild.GetLibs">
      </antTask>

In the latest builds (GM3) you can find more info on contributing tasks in the 
Help -> Help Contents -> Platform Plug-in Developer Guide -> Programmer's 
Guide -> Platform Ant Support.

One of the things mentioned is that your plug-in library MUST NOT contain any 
Ant tasks. It has to be provided in a separate JAR (the one declared in the 
extension point above).

While I would of course prefer to debug my ant tasks in a runtime-workbench 
without first having to package them as a jar file, it sounds like this would 
be difficult to support since ant tasks are using a separate class loader, and 
eclipse doesn't keep track of which classes belong to which jar file. The 
latest docs are quite clear.
